facts: Obama ran for Senate in Illinois in 2004 against opponent Alan Keyes This was the first time in US history that two African Americans were running for a major party Senate seat
Barack Obama Wrote Several Books including Dreams from My Father and Audacity of hope
Barack Obama went through a difficult childhood, with his father leaving him at the age of two his mother then remarried and they moved to Indonesia

After his mother divorced her second husband, she sent Obama back to Hawaii to live with his grandparents. They supported him in his studies and he was able to go to one of Hawaii’s best schools, Punahou School, graduating with honors
During his studies at Harvard, Obama became the first black president of the Harvard Law Review.
Obama married Michelle in 1992, and they have two daughters, Malia and Sasha.
Barack Obama Is a great fan of the Harry Potter Books
Barack Obama Favorite Meal is Shrimp Linguine when Made By His Wife Michelle
Barack means blessed in Swahili and Semitic languages
Barack Obama was named Time Magazine’s Person of the Year In 2009
Barack Obama was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2012
Barack Obama is left handed, the sixth post war president to be left handed
Barack Obama worked in a Baskin Robbins ice cream shop as a teenager and now can't stand ice cream
Barack Obama favourite snacks are chocolate peanut protein bars
Barack Obama ate dog meat, snake meat, and roasted grasshopper while living in Indonesia
Barack Obama can speak Spanish
While on the campaign trail Barack Obama refused to watch CNN and had sports channels on instead
Barack Obama favourite drink is black forest berry iced tea
Barack Obama promised Michelle he would quit smoking before running for president. He didn't
Barack Obama kept a pet ape called Tata while in Indonesia
Barack Obama can bench press an impressive 200 pounds
Barack Obama was known as Barry until university when he asked to be addressed by his full name
Barack Obama favourite book is Moby Dick by Herman Melville
Barack Obama visited Wokingham, Berks, in 1996 for the stag party of his half sister's fiance, but left when a stripper arrived
Barack Obamas desk in his Senate office once belonged to Robert Kennedy
Barack's favourite films are Casablanca and One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Barack carries a tiny Madonna and child statue and a bracelet belonging to a soldier in Iraq for good luck
Barack applied to appear in a black pin-up calendar while at Harvard but was rejected by the all-female committee.
Barack's favourite music includes Miles Davis, Bob Dylan, Bach and The Fugees
Barack took Michelle to see the Spike Lee film Do The Right Thing on their first date
Barack enjoys playing Scrabble and poker
Barack doesn't drink coffee and rarely drinks alcohol
Barack would have liked to have been an architect if he were not a politician
As a teenager Barack took drugs including marijuana and cocaine
Barack hates the youth trend for trousers which sag beneath the backside
Barack repaid his student loan only four years ago after signing his book deal
Barack's house in Chicago has four fire places
Barack's Daughter Malia's godmother is Jesse Jackson's daughter Santita
Barack says his worst habit is constantly checking his BlackBerry
Barack uses an Apple Mac laptop
Barack drives a Ford Escape Hybrid, having ditched his gas-guzzling Chrysler 300
Barack wears 1,500 dollar Hart Schaffner Marx suits
Barack owns four identical pairs of black size 11 shoes
Barack has his hair cut once a week by his Chicago barber, Zariff, who charges 21 dollars
Baracks favourite fictional television programmes are Mash and The Wire
Barack was given the code name Renegade by his Secret Service handlers
Barack was nicknamed Bar by his late grandmother
Barack's favourite artist is Pablo Picasso
Barack's speciality as a cook is chilli
Barack has said many of his friends in Indonesia were street urchins
Barack keeps on his desk a carving of a wooden hand holding an egg, a Kenyan symbol of the fragility of life
Barack's late father was a senior economist for the Kenyan government
